menu_ssml: Welcome to the Spelling Bee! I am Cortana and I will be your host today! Say "new game" to get started or choose one of the following options: "challenge", "leaderboard", "about". Depending on the device you have, you can say, type or select these options on the screen - give it a try!
leaderboard_ssml: This is the global leaderboard, our own little Hall of Fame for the best spellers out there. Is your name in this list yet? Remember, practice makes perfect!
challenge_subtitle: In challenge mode you and your friend will spell the same words and complete for the highest score.
challenge_ssml: In challenge mode you and your friend will spell the same words and complete for the highest score. And bragging rights, of course. Say "accept" if you have been invited already or "create" to start a new challenge.
challenge_join: Please type the four-digit challenge code, that your friend shared with you:
challenge_join_ssml: Please say the four-digit challenge code, that your friend shared with you:
challenge_failure: I am sorry, the token you entered does not exist in our database. Please try again.
challenge_failure_ssml: I am sorry, the token you entered does not exist in our database. Please try again.
challenge_success: The token was successfully found. Are you ready to accept your friend's challenge?
challenge_success_ssml: The token was successfully found... Say "start" if you're ready to accept your friend's challenge or "cancel" to do it later.
challenge_create: Your challenge has been created! Challenge your friend to beat your score in this game by sharing this access token with them: %s.
challenge_create_ssml: Your challenge has been created! Challenge your friend to beat your score in this game by sharing this access token with them: "%s". Say "start" to begin this challenge or "cancel" to get back to the menu.
question_subtitle: Please pay attention to this round's word. When you are ready, type or speak your response letter by letter, or select one of the following options:
question_ssml: Round %d... The word for the current round is... %s... One more time, the word is... %s... Feel free to ask me to repeat, define or provide an example sentence.
definition_subtitle: Here is a definition for this round's word: %s.
sentence_subtitle: Here is an example sentence for this round's word: %s.
finalscore_subtitle: Thanks for playing Spelling Bee! Your score is %d (out of possible %d). Challenge your friends to spell the same words you just did by sharing this token with them: %s.
answer_correct_subtitle: Congratulations! You've spelled the word %s as "%s", and that is perfectly correct!
answer_incorrect_subtitle: I am sorry, but unfortunately your answer wasn't correct. You've spelled the word %s as "%s", but the correct response is "%s".
answer_subtitle: Your score is %d points out of possible %d.
answer_next_ssml: Say "next" for the following round or "finish" to stop playing.
challenge_score: The best score set by the opponent in this challenge is %d points so far.
about_subtitle: Built with <3 by Dmitrii Cucleschin <dmitc> and Ondrej Stastny <ostastny> of Bing Homepage team.
about_ssml: Built with love by Dimitri and Ondrej of Bing Homepage team. No digital assistants were hurt in making of this bot.
gameover_win: Congratulations! You've beat your friend's challenge, setting the new high score of %d points (as compared to his score of %d ppints)! How does it feel, to be the best speller in the room?
gameover_win_ssml: Congratulations! You've beat your friend's challenge, setting the new high score of %d points (as compared to his score of %d ppints)! How does it feel, to be the best speller in the room?
gameover_loss: I am sorry, but your score of %d points did not break your friend's high score of %d points. Study some more and try again later?
gameover_loss_ssml: I am sorry, but your score of %d points did not break your friend's high score of %d points. Study some more and try again later?
gameover_draw: Looks like it's a draw! Both you and your friend are sharing the high score of %d points. I guess this one will have to be settled over rock-paper-scissors?
